page.title: 07RELIGION ST.PETER'S CHURCH.
page.content: St. Peter's Church,Cowfold is 750 years old.It is built of sandstone and is set in a large churchyard.The wooden fence surounding it has farm names carved on the posts.This is an old Sussex custom dating back to Saxon times.The farms in the Parish were responsible for the maintenance of one panel of oak fencing.The first vicar was called William,the present one is called The Rev.Basil Brenton.Inside the church there is a beautiful brass of Prior Thomas Nelond which is 552 years old.It is under a carpet which is padlocked to the floor.The brass is over 10 ft.long and is the largest in Sussex.The church has six bells.The oldest windows in the church are the Primrose Windows.There is a wind0w of St.Francis designed by Geoffrey Webb who signed his name with a cobweb. The tower has 64 steps and 6 bells.
